title: SWEET | English meaning - Cambridge Dictionary
text: sweet adjective uk /swiːt/ us /swiːt/sweet adjective (TASTE) sweet adjective (PLEASANT) A2 What a sweet baby! - attractiveHe's an attractive, intelligent man. - appealingShe has an appealing sense of humour. - engagingHe is a very engaging conversationalist. - adorableShe has an adorable little sister. - lovelyHe's such a lovely lad. - sweetYour kids are so sweet. I think Alex is really sweet. It was sweet of you to help me. - kindYou'll never meet a kinder person. - niceHe's such a nice guy. - sweetShe's the sweetest little girl in the whole class. - good toJay's mother has been very good to us. - good-heartedHe's a good-hearted kid who loves to help out. - agreeable - agreeableness - agreeably - all things to all people idiom - attractive - delightfully - distraction - diverting - divertingly - do someone's heart good idiom - homey - indulgent - indulgently - jovial - jovially - sensually - sensuous - sensuously - serendipitous - sweeten You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics: sweet noun uk /swiːt/ us /swiːt/ [ C or U ] UK - almond paste - baking chocolate - barley sugar - bitter chocolate - bittersweet chocolate - confectionery - cooking chocolate - cotton candy - couverture - cracknel - Liquorice Allsorts - lollipop - lolly - marchpane - marron glacé - spun sugar - stick of rock - sugared almond - sugarplum - sweet chocolate You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics: Idiom sweet exclamation mainly US Australian English informal uk /swiːt/ us /swiːt/
